Connectivity Issues in Canada

Understanding the Problem and Its Impact on Cloud Gaming

What is the Issue?

Connectivity remains a significant challenge in Canada, particularly in rural and remote areas. Limited access to high-speed internet and reliable cellular networks creates a digital divide, leaving communities disconnected from essential online services and emerging technologies.

Impact on Cloud Gaming

Cloud gaming relies heavily on stable, high-speed internet connections to deliver a seamless gaming experience. Without adequate connectivity, players in underserved regions face:

  • Laggy or unresponsive gameplay due to high latency.
  • Inability to access or stream games from cloud services.
  • Missed opportunities to engage with new gaming technologies.
  • low bit rates and resolution.

Why is This Important?

Cloud gaming represents the future of gaming by reducing the need for expensive hardware, enabling access across devices, allow developers to develop for one system, allow companies to focus on making games rather then expensive hardware, no updates and long installs, and offering flexibility in gameplay. However, without proper internet infrastructure, rural and remote Canadians risk being excluded from these advancements.

Key Challenges

Infrastructure Gaps

Many regions lack the fiber-optic or 5G networks needed to support modern internet demands.

Geographic Challenges

Northern Canada faces unique obstacles, including harsh weather and vast distances, which make building infrastructure costly and complex.
